title: What is Pixel-AI-Hack?
content: Pixel-AI-Hack is an immersive hackathon designed to bring together designers, developers, and innovators to explore the synergy between AI, Design Thinking, and Technology. Participants will ideate and create AI-powered solutions for real-world challenges.

title: Who is organizing this event?
content: The event is organized by FEDKIIT in collaboration with TBI (Technology Business Incubator) to promote AI-driven innovation and problem-solving using design thinking methodologies.

title: When and where will the event be held?
content:
Pixel-AI-Hack will be conducted across three days:
- Day 1 (Workshops & Ideation) - Camp-17 Audi
- Day 2 (Pitching Round) - Camp-14 Lab
- Day 3 (Final Submission & Showcase) - Online

title: Is there a participation fee?
content: No, participation in Pixel-AI-Hack is completely free. However, participants must register in advance to secure their spot.

title: What will I gain from this hackathon?
content: You will learn Design Thinking methodologies, explore AI development tools, participate in hands-on workshops, and build AI-driven solutions. Additionally, youâ€™ll gain networking opportunities, mentorship, and a chance to win prizes.

title: How do I register for Pixel-AI-Hack?
content: Click on the 'Register Now' button on the official event page and complete the registration process. Stay tuned for email updates after registering.

title: What is the format of the hackathon?
content:
Pixel-AI-Hack is divided into three phases:
- Day 1: Workshops on Design Thinking & AI, problem statement selection.
- Day 2: Pitching round for shortlisted teams.
- Day 3: 24-hour project development & final submission (Online).

title: Do I need a team to participate?
content: Yes, participants must form teams of 4-5 members. If you don't have a team, networking sessions will help you find one.

title: What are the judging criteria?
content:
Projects will be evaluated based on:
- Innovation & Uniqueness
- Feasibility & Practicality
- AI Integration & Use of Design Thinking
- Presentation & Clarity

title: What are the prizes and recognition?
content: The top 3 winning teams will be recognized in an offline felicitation ceremony at TBI with certificates and prizes. All participants will receive certificates of participation.

title: Can I use a pre-built project?
content: No, all projects must be built during the hackathon to ensure fair competition.

title: Where can I find more updates?
content: Stay updated through the official FEDKIIT website and social media channels. For specific queries, reach out to the organizers.
